greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0)=2, a(1)=1, a(2)=0; thereafter a(n) = a(n-1-a(n-1))+a(n-2-a(n-2)) unless a(n-1) <= n-1 or a(n-2) <= n-2 in which case the sequence terminates.
comment: a(A241218(n)) = n and a(m) <> n for m < A241218(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 17 2014
reference: Higham, Jeff and Tanny, Stephen, A tamely chaotic meta-Fibonacci sequence. Twenty-third Manitoba Conference on Numerical Mathematics and Computing (Winnipeg, MB, 1993). Congr. Numer. 99 (1994), 67-94. [Contains a detailed analysis of this sequence]
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
Rémy Sigrist, Colored scatterplot of a(n) for n = 0..20000 (where the color is function of n mod 3)
program: where xs = map a240808 $ zipWith (-) [1..] $ tail a240808_list
xref: A006949 and A240807 have the same recurrence but different initial conditions.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 15 2014
